com.db.chart.view

Class ChartView

  • java.lang.Object
    • RelativeLayout
      • com.db.chart.view.ChartView
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BaseBarChartView, LineChartView

    public abstract class ChartView
extends RelativeLayout
    Abstract class to be extend to define any chart that implies axis.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ChartView.Orientation 
      class  ChartView.Style
      Class responsible to style the Graph! Can be instantiated with or without attributes.

      • onTouchEvent

        public boolean onTouchEvent(MotionEvent event)
        The method listens for chart clicks and checks whether it intercepts a known Region. It will then use the registered Listener.onClick to return the region's index.

      • onDraw

        protected void onDraw(Canvas canvas)

      • onDrawChart

        protected abstract void onDrawChart(Canvas canvas,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<ChartSet> data)
        Method responsible to draw bars with the parsed screen points.
        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas to draw on
        data - ArrayList of ChartSet to use while drawing the Chart

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Method not expected to be used often. More for testing. Resets chart state to insert new configuration.

      • updateValues

        public ChartView updateValues(int setIndex,
                              float[] values)
        Update set values. Animation support in case previously added.
        Parameters:
        setIndex - Index of set to be updated
        values - Array of new values. Array length must match current data
        Returns:
        ChartView self-reference.

      • notifyDataUpdate

        public void notifyDataUpdate()
        Notify ChartView about updated values. ChartView will be validated.

      • showTooltip

        public void showTooltip(Tooltip tooltip,
                        boolean correctPos)
        Adds a tooltip to ChartView. If is not the case already, the whole tooltip is forced to be inside ChartView bounds. The area used to apply the correction exclude any padding applied, the whole view size in the layout is take into account.
        Parameters:
        tooltip - Tooltip view to be added
        correctPos - False if tooltip should not be forced to be inside ChartView. You may want to take care of it.

      • dismissAllTooltips

        public void dismissAllTooltips()
        Removes all tooltips currently presented in the chart.

      • canIPleaseAskYouToDraw

        public boolean canIPleaseAskYouToDraw()
        Asks the view if it is able to draw now.
        Returns:
        ChartView self-reference.

      • getOrientation

        public ChartView.Orientation getOrientation()
        Get orientation of chart.
        Returns:
        Object of type ChartView.Orientation defining an horizontal or vertical orientation. Orientation.HORIZONTAL | Orientation.VERTICAL

      • getInnerChartBottom

        public float getInnerChartBottom()
        Inner Chart refers only to the area where chart data will be draw, excluding labels, axis, etc.
        Returns:
        Position of the inner bottom side of the chart

        Returns:
        Position of 0 value on chart

      • setStep

        public ChartView setStep(int step)
        A step is seen as the step to be defined between 2 labels. As an example a step of 2 with a max label value of 6 will end up with {0, 2, 4, 6} as labels.
        Parameters:
        step - (real) value distance from every label
        Returns:
        ChartView self-reference.

      • setBorderSpacing

        public ChartView setBorderSpacing(int spacing)
        Parameters:
        spacing - Spacing between left/right of the chart and the first/last label
        Returns:
        ChartView self-reference.

      • getData

        public java.util.ArrayList<ChartSet> getData()
        Get the whole data owned by the chart.
        Returns:
        List of ChartSet owned by the chart

      • getEntriesArea

        public java.util.ArrayList<Rect> getEntriesArea(int index)
        Get the list of android.graphics.Rect associated to each entry of a ChartSet.
        Parameters:
        index - ChartSet index
        Returns:
        The list of android.graphics.Rect for the specified dataset

      • getChartAnimation

        public Animation getChartAnimation()
        Get the current Animation held by ChartView. Useful, for instance, to define another endAction.
        Returns:
        Current Animation

      • setYLabels

        public ChartView setYLabels(AxisRenderer.LabelPosition position)
        Show/Hide Y labels and respective axis.
        Parameters:
        position - NONE - No labels OUTSIDE - Labels will be positioned outside the chart INSIDE - Labels will be positioned inside the chart
        Returns:
        ChartView self-reference.

        Returns:
        ChartView self-reference.

      • setAxisBorderValues

        public ChartView setAxisBorderValues(float minValue,
                                     float maxValue,
                                     float step)
        A step is seen as the step to be defined between 2 labels. As an example a step of 2 with a maxAxisValue of 6 will end up with {0, 2, 4, 6} as labels.
        Parameters:
        minValue - The minimum value that Y axis will have as a label
        maxValue - The maximum value that Y axis will have as a label
        step - (real) value distance from every label
        Returns:
        ChartView self-reference.

      • setAxisBorderValues

        public ChartView setAxisBorderValues(float minValue,
                                     float maxValue)
        Parameters:
        minValue - The minimum value that Y axis will have as a label
        maxValue - The maximum value that Y axis will have as a label
        Returns:
        ChartView self-reference.

      • setGrid

        public ChartView setGrid(int rows,
                         int columns,
                         Paint paint)
        Apply grid to chart.
        Parameters:
        rows - Grid's number of rows
        columns - Grid's number of columns
        paint - The Paint instance that will be used to draw the grid If null the grid won't be drawn
        Returns:
        ChartView self-reference.

      • setValueThreshold

        public ChartView setValueThreshold(float startValue,
                                   float endValue,
                                   Paint paint)
        Display a value threshold either in a form of line or band. In order to produce a line, the start and end value will be equal.
        Parameters:
        startValue - Threshold value.
        endValue - Threshold value.
        paint - The Paint instance that will be used to draw the grid If null the grid won't be drawn
        Returns:
        ChartView self-reference.

      • setValueThreshold

        public ChartView setValueThreshold(float[] startValues,
                                   float[] endValues,
                                   Paint paint)
        Display a value threshold either in a form of line or band. In order to produce a line, the start and end value will be equal.
        Parameters:
        startValues - Threshold values.
        endValues - Threshold values.
        paint - The Paint instance that will be used to draw the grid If null the grid won't be drawn
        Returns:
        ChartView self-reference.

      • setLabelThreshold

        public ChartView setLabelThreshold(int startLabel,
                                   int endLabel,
                                   Paint paint)
        Display a label threshold either in a form of line or band. In order to produce a line, the start and end label will be equal.
        Parameters:
        startLabel - Threshold start label index.
        endLabel - Threshold end label index.
        paint - The Paint instance that will be used to draw the grid If null the grid won't be drawn
        Returns:
        ChartView self-reference.

      • setLabelThreshold

        public ChartView setLabelThreshold(int[] startLabels,

        Parameters:

        endLabels - Threshold end label index.

        Returns:
        ChartView self-reference.

      • applyShadow

        protected void applyShadow(Paint paint,
                           float alpha,
                           float dx,
                           float dy,
                           float radius,
                           int[] color)
        Applies an alpha to the paint object.
        Parameters:
        paint - android.graphics.Paint object to apply alpha
        alpha - Alpha value (opacity)
        dx - Dx
        dy - Dy
        radius - Radius
        color - Color
